detail.content: Core Production: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Core Production Courses  A "CORE" production course is defined by its overall scope in the production of a project. Typically, a student taking a CORE production is involved in every aspect of creating a project - the scriptwriting, producing, directing, shooting, and editing. (A "Craft" course, by comparison, concentrates on only one aspect of the project creation as just the directing, just the producing, just the editing, etc.)    All courses are arranged by subject areas and by level: Introductory, Fundamental, Intermediate, and Advanced. Some courses may not be offered in a given academic year. Consult each semester’s schedule for specific information.    Students must complete 4 Core Production courses for a minimum of 20 points. However, only one CORE production course may be taken each semester due to the strenuous nature of these courses. Click on a course title in the related links to read the course description.    BEGINNING BASICS    Sound Image Frame and Sequence    ANIMATION CORE PRODUCTION    Introduction to Animation Techniques Intermediate Animation Production Advanced 3D Computer Animation Workshop Advanced Animation Production Experimental Animation    FILM CORE PRODUCTION    Sight & Sound Filmmaking Intermediate Narrative Production Workshop Intermediate Experimental Workshop Intermediate Production: Short Commercial Forms Advanced Experimental Workshop Narrative Workshop Advanced Film Production Workshop I & II    TELEVISION CORE PRODUCTION    Sight & Sound: Studio Intermediate Television Workshop Advanced Television Workshop Television Production Workshop Children’s TV Production Workshop    DOCUMENTARY CORE PRODUCTION    Sight & Sound: Documentary Documentary Production Workshop    STUDY ABROAD CORE PRODUCTION (find descriptions on Study Abroad website)    Documentary in Havana 35mm Cinematography and Film Production in Prague     Advanced 3D Computer Animation Workshop Advanced Animation Production Advanced Experimental Workshop  Advanced Production Workshop I Advanced Production Workshop II Advanced Television Production Workshop Children's Television Production Workshop Children’s TV Production Workshop Documentary Production Workshop Experimental Animation Experimental Workshop Frame & Sequence Intermediate Animation Production Intermediate Narrative Production Workshop Intermediate Production: Short Commercial Forms Intermediate TV Workshop Introduction to Animation Techniques Narrative Workshop Sight & Sound: Documentary Sight & Sound: Filmmaking Sight & Sound: Studio Sound Image           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Fundraising: Kanbar Institute of Film & TV Production Fund: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Fundraising: Kanbar Institute of Film & Television Production Fund  For projects produced in the following classes:    Undergraduate: Narrative Workshop, Advanced Production, Advanced Experimental, Advanced Documentary, Intermediate Experimental, Intermediate Narrative Workshop, Intermediate Television, Children's Television Workshop, Documentary Workshop, Broadcast Documentary, and Advanced Television    Graduate: 2nd Year and Graduate Thesis    A system is in place whereby money for student film projects can be donated to an ongoing restricted fund at NYUs Tisch School of the Arts. The Film Production Fund may provide production grants to student projects. Student producers and directors solicit funds for their productions as tax deductible donations to the University. This is done by carefully observing the guidelines listed below.    Rules Governing Fundraising and the Production Fund       You must understand, and your donor should be advised, that your fundraising effort is necessarily characterized by an all for one, one for all spirit on behalf of all students here, in which there is no obligation on the part of the school to restrictively award the proceeds of your effort directly to you or your project. This does not preclude your donor noting special interest in your project, as accounted for in the transmittal letter.       All contributions must be accompanied by the transmittal letter.       No donations should be solicited from family members or close family friends. No relative of the director or of any crew member may make a donation to a specific film project through the Production Fund. The tax-deductible gift status cannot be granted in such situations.       You must be a TSOA Film/TV major and you must be matriculated. The only exception to the requirement of matriculation is if you graduate. The Fund is available for use for three months from the date of graduation. Any money received by or remaining in the Fund after you graduate is forfeited to the Fund three months from that date.       You must obtain written approval from your production instructor, addressed to Mr. Derrick Bethune, before embarking on your fund raising activities. These activities must be on behalf of a particular project in that instructors class. No outside unofficial projects may solicit funds.       Aggregate donations must total at least $500 for your project to be eligible for a potential production grant from the Film Production Fund. Please allow at least 2 weeks for the processing of the donation check.       Once a donation has been solicited and submitted to the Department of Film and Television Budget Office, it is the students responsibility to notify that office when he/she wishes to have a production grant check processed. It will take four weeks from the time a donation is submitted until the money may be received. It requires two weeks from the time the check is received by the Budget Office until it may be requested as grant money, and it requires an additional two weeks until a check from that money may be issued by the University.       Once in receipt of monies from The Film Production Fund, the student is strongly advised to retain all appropriate receipts against your allotment.       Each production will receive no more than 80% of the contributed funds. The remaining 20% will be used for Departmental Post-Production Awards.
